intro: Bomarea patinii subsp. glabrata, commonly known as the smooth bomarea, is a species of flowering plant in the family Alstroemeriaceae. It is native to the Andean regions of South America, particularly in Ecuador and Peru. The plant is characterized by its striking, tubular flowers that are typically violet or purple in color. It grows as a herbaceous perennial, often found in moist, shaded forest environments. Its leaves are usually lance-shaped and have a smooth texture, contributing to its common name.
